node.title: 'We are left off the map': Govt urged to do something about housing crisis in Tasmania's north-west
node.alt: A woman outside with two dogs.
node.description: Rochelle Gordon has had to postpone knee replacement surgery three times due to her public housing unit being in no state for her recovery â€” her story is just one of many, amid pleas for something to be done about Tasmania's public housing crisis.
node.content:
["Rochelle Gordon has been on the priority public housing waiting list for two-and-a-half years, and she says it is damaging her physical and mental health.\u00a0", "Her private rental in Stanley has uneven floors, a shower over a bath stained with rust, narrow access paths and low doorways, but it's all she can afford.\u00a0", "The 64-year-old has had to postpone knee replacement surgery three times because her current house isn't a suitable place for recovery.\u00a0", "She has tried to find another rental, but they are thin on the ground.\u00a0", "\"Most of them are frightfully expensive. I live on a disability support pension,\" she said.", "\"The other thing is there are no rentals, not that I'm aware of, and if there was a rental it might be miles away from anywhere.\"\u00a0", "", "
Rochelle Gordon's physical and mental health have\u00a0deteriorated while she waits for an appropriate public housing property to become available.(ABC News: Piia Wirsu)
", "Ms Gordon also lives with depression, and her two dogs Emily and Charlotte are her lifeline.\u00a0", "She said she is hoping for a place where she can improve her physical and mental health.\u00a0", "\"In all fairness, I was offered a unit here but it was too depressing and I turned it down,\" she said.\u00a0", "She says moving to another area without her support networks around isn't an option.\u00a0", "\"The thing is, I'm connected with this community,\" she said.", "\"If there was somewhere suitable to live, I'd cheerfully stay in Stanley forever.\"\u00a0", "", "
Dianne Baldock said homelessness is a big problem in the Circular Head community.(Supplied: Piia Wirsu)
", "Interim general manager of the Circular Head Aboriginal Corporation Dianne Baldock said some people would rather face homelessness than move away from Circular Head.\u00a0", "\"People don't want to move away because of their family connections and supports that they already have in place,\" she said.", "
'Don't forget regional Tasmania'
", "Circular Head in Tasmania's northwest is facing acute housing pressure, with rental prices jumping by 34 per cent in the past five years according to Real Estate Institute of Tasmania data.\u00a0", "\"A lot of older people at the moment are presenting with nowhere to live or being evicted due to high rents,\" Ms Baldock said.\u00a0", "Average rents have jumped from around $200 a week to $300, but Ms Baldock said they could be as high as $450.", "\"Four hundred to $450 a week for rent is just outrageous,\" she said.\u00a0", "Housing stress in Tasmania's major centres has been in the spotlight in recent years as the property market booms.", "But Ms Baldock is worried the regions are being forgotten.\u00a0", "
More public housing needed
", "Circular Head Mayor Daryl Quilliam said the rental pressures were adding to the public housing waiting list.\u00a0", "\"We haven't had any public housing, or very few public housing for probably 20 years now,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We haven't had the need either, but we have got the need now.\"", "", "
Rochelle Gordon has been on the public housing priority waiting list for two and a half years.(ABC News: Piia Wirsu)
", "Minister for Housing Michael Ferguson said there were 96 public housing properties in the region and $120.6 million has been allocated to fund 58 new dwellings, set to be complete by June 2023.\u00a0", "\"This will assist in providing housing to the priority cases among the 132 people who have applied for a Housing Tasmania property who have listed the Circular Head region as a residential option,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"The Tasmanian government is committed to building a more sustainable housing system.\"", "Centacare Evolve Housing CEO Ben Wilson said they had\u00a0worked with the government to identify areas of need.\u00a0", "\"Every regional area is seeing demand for new supply, and in particular Circular Head,\" Mr Wilson said.\u00a0", "Ms Gordon hopes new public housing will help everyone in a similar position to her.", "\"I'm not just doing this interview for myself and my two little happy hounds, I'm doing this for all the other people in this extremely wealthy first world country who are experiencing housing stress.\""]
